etymologies: early 20th century. From fe- (in ferro-) + m- + -ic

definitions: Designating a primary category of igneous rocks whose chemical composition can be expressed in terms of a group of standard minerals which are relatively rich in iron and magnesium and poor in aluminium and silicon; of or relating to such rocks and their associated minerals. Contrasted with salic.

notes.text: The classification was devised by the American geologists W. Cross, J. P. Iddings, L. V. Pirsson, and H. S. Washington.
